video.title: Develop an AI to play Connect Four - Python Tutorial
video.description:
Learn how to create an expert level artificial intelligence to play Connect Four using Python. We start out with a very simple implementation of just dropping a piece randomly and then progress to choosing a column based on score and then finally implementing the minimax algorithm with alpha beta pruning.

💻 Initial code: https://github.com/KeithGalli/Connect4-Python

🎥Developing the initial connect four game: https://youtu.be/XpYz-q1lxu8
🎥How a board game AI works: https://youtu.be/y7AKtWGOPAE
🎥Alpha-beta pruning: https://youtu.be/l-hh51ncgDI

Video from Keith Galli. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCq6XkhO5SZ66N04IcPbqNcw

Keith on social media:
https://www.instagram.com/keithgalli/
https://twitter.com/keithgalli/

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: Keith Galli
topLevelComment.text: Thanks for watching guys! Check out my channel for more python programming videos :)

topLevelComment.author: Yasmine
topLevelComment.text:
Hi, thank you for making this video
I got this error when i tried  to run the code: 
    line 1, in <module>
    import numpy as np
    ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'numpy'

Please tell me what should i do ?

replies.author: Aryan
replies.text: Hey, i know the answer to your question but you must be a very beginner if you dont know the answer to tat in which case i suggest you first learn python completely anyways, you have to go to your command line(if your using windows) and type "pip install numpy"

topLevelComment.author: Bob Hiltner
topLevelComment.text: Nice demo--learning about 2-player game dev. And also not AI, simply human algorithm-weighted scoring..

replies.author: P N
replies.text: I was looking for this comment, hehe. If understand AI correctly it can learn based on input and make decisions. This is just coding the optimal algorithms yourself. This doesn’t learn.

topLevelComment.author: Brother Lui
topLevelComment.text: Sorry but MiniMax with Alpha-Beta pruning is NOT an A.I. Please don't use clickbait titles just for views. Looking forward to a solution with a simple NN, GAN or LSTM.

replies.author: NoahF
replies.text: As said, it is not a machine learning method but is and A.I. All AI is Artificial Intelligence. This program and algorithm is designed to mimic intelligence in its choices and therefore is an AI

replies.author: Dave Langers
replies.text:
It certainly is Artificial Intelligence, dear sir. It is not Deep Learning, as you seem to expect, and likely not even Machine Learning, but that wasn't claimed.

Btw: it would be gentlemanlike to withdraw the clickbait remark IMHO.

replies.author: Suparerk Manitpornsut
replies.text: If you read the AI books, MiniMax is in there. Maybe very first chapter or at least in Searching. NN is great but I don’t think NN or LSTM can provide a much better result for this kind of problem.
